What are the constraints encountered by: Constraints encountered by the town hall in terms of solid waste a) the inhabitants of the area prevent the town hall from throwing waste in the chosen place, especially when there is a lot of waste.

What are the constraints encountered by: The constraints encountered by the town hall in the field of solid waste employees are unable to find their fees on time (salary) this prevents the staff responsible for solid waste from performing their tasks regularly.

What are the town hall's priorities in t: The priorities of the town hall a) waste collection, keeping our environment clean, cleans up the city.
What are the expectations, the needs of: The expectations of the town hall keep the whole town very clean, participate in waste management, treatment, sorting, recycling and waste recovery. The needs of the town hall to know the different types of Truck, wheelbarrow, shovel and Rato.

What are the constraints encountered by: In the municipality of Limonade we have material and financial constraints.

What are the expectations, the needs of: The expectations of the town hall is to find sufficient materials that can serve the lemonade community in the management of solid waste. The needs of the town hall a) rolling stock, sanitation equipment and means of financing.

What are the expectations, the needs of: Find stable financial means, adequate and necessary materials, support from local and international organizations interested in the field of solid waste management.

What are the constraints encountered by: -In the Economy, especially in the financing parameter of the town hall out of a total of 150,000 buildings (households, churches, businesses, schools and others), more than 140,000 do not pay their taxes. The 6 to 7 thousand who pay are not regular. It happens that we can have a breakdown, unfortunately we call it a breakdown of 125,000 gourdes for the proper functioning of the ROAD SERVICE because there is a disproportionality ie we receive less to spend more than 'we received - Politics: fierce opponents of the Cartel can put piles of garbage somewhere either in front of the Carrefour peace court and call the press to do interviews on the unhealthy situation in the city.
What are the town hall's priorities in t: Sanitation, always sanitizing the city is our priority, especially the areas that have a view of the national road #2
What are the expectations, the needs of: Subsidies from the central state for payrolls because we can have a salary arrears of more than 10 months at the level of the ROAD SERVICE - Support from the central state, especially MTPTC, in equipment as a dispenser to flatten the waste and Grdeur to unclog the gorged canals - International support such as sanitation projects, for example from the Le Lamentin twinning committee, in Martinique, and from Carrefour, in Haiti which shared 18 machines with the municipality of Carrefour heavy, of the mayor Le Lamentin, Pierre SAMOT whose communal school pierre samot de Carrefour which is opposite the town hall of Carrefour, bears his name. NB- The Town Hall of Carrefour was equipped with 18 heavy machines like Don and 5 heavy machines which already belonged to the town hall, a total of 23 heavy machines for 46 drivers.
